newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil coffee differentials shy away from New York.
newsitem.headline: Brazil coffee differentials shy away from New York.

text.p: Brazilian coffee traders were scratching their heads over widening differentials at a time of rising New York prices but even so buyers were showing little interest, they said.

Brazil 2/3 17/18s were today quoted in the Rio de Janeiro Coffee Center Bulletin at a 10/11 point discount as opposed to a seven/eight point differential at the start of the week. At the beginning of the month the discount was 1.50 to five cents.
"Brazilian differentials are if anything falling back while prices are moving higher and higher. Moreover buyers are holding back as if they are looking for even larger differentials," dealers said.
Traders were likewise at a loss to find any fresh fundamental news for the recent rally which saw many contracts in New York hitting new highs today.
"All we can see is that there is a squeeze on fine coffees," one dealer said.
Dealers cited prices of up to $500 per 50-kg bag at the most recent Kenyan auction which effectively meant premiums of up to $300 over New York as opposed to more normal premiums of $100, they said.
The May/July switch was also hitting interest and together with a Brazilian public holiday for May Day which many were extending through Friday, this week was seen as very uneventful.
Looking ahead to the first week in May however, a series of meetings were scheduled.
On May 7 the second official meeting of Brazil's coffee council, the CDPC, was due to examine a report on restructuring producer debt.
In preparation for this meeting, council members, minus the council's minister Industry and Commerce Minister Francisco Dornelles, are scheduled to meet in Belo Horizonte on May 6.

Then on May 8, a six-member commission from Brazil's two exporter entities are to hold the first set of talks on whether they can form a new, united organisation following a split which took place in November 1995.
